intro: Descurainia incana subsp. procera, commonly known as hoary tansy, is a flowering plant native to the northern hemisphere. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and small yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. Its morphology and ecological preferences make it an important species in certain ecosystems.
